sections.name: Animated Dragonstorms
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Construct
traits.text: A construct is an artificial creature empowered by a force other than vitality or void.

traits.name: Mindless
traits.text: A mindless creature has either programmed or rudimentary mental attributes. Most, if not all, of their mental attribute modifiers are –5. They are immune to all mental effects.

automatic_abilities.name: Vulnerable to Dispelling
automatic_abilities.text: The animated dragonstorm can be targeted by *disjunction* and *dispel magic*. If targeted by such a spell of 9th level or higher, the construct loses its resistance to acid, cold, electricity, fire, and physical damage and is slowed 1 for 1d4 rounds.

traits.name: Deadly
traits.text: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon’s damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a _greater striking rune_ and three dice if the weapon has a _major striking rune_. For instance, a rapier with a _greater striking rune_ deals 2d8 extra piercing damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon’s normal damage dice doesn’t change the size of its deadly die.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: This weapon can be used to attack enemies up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent enemies. For creatures with reach, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

ability.name: Channel Dragonstorm

traits.name: Divine
traits.text:
This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to divine magic.

ability.text: The animated dragonstorm directs a 30-foot cone of dragonstorm energy. This deals 3d8 acid, 3d8 cold, 3d8 electricity, 3d8 fire, and 3d8 poison damage to creatures in the cone (DC 40 basic Reflex save). The animated dragonstorm can't use Channel Dragonstorm again for 1d4 rounds.

ability.name: Destructive Strikes
ability.text: The animated dragonstorm's attacks ignore the Hardness of objects with Hardness 20 or less.

ability.name: Dragonstorm Strike
ability.text: On a critical hit, the animated dragonstorm's fist bursts with dragonstorm energy. The target takes 1d6 acid, 1d6 cold, 1d6 electricity, 1d6 fire, and 1d6 poison damage.
